channel.title: Errors

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:176610”] else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin") || playerRights >= 3)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 100000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Stop cheating you fuckin prick!"); } }

This is my pickup command. You may or may not need the last }. Try it with it, then try without.[/quote]

You need the try, he needs that last bracket(Count the opening brackets and closing brackets) it’s suppose to come out to an even number.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @BORED BORED
item.description:
@BORED wrote:

Replace All With This else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 2) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 20000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10"); }

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @omg_ffs_ownd omg ffs ownd
item.description:
@omg_ffs_ownd wrote:

umm lmao you can space after an if, doesn’t matter. illegal start of type COULD mean that your missing a " } " directly above the if statement. might not be DIRECTLY above that if statement, look above that code and see if there is any missing closing brackets.

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Bacus23 Bacus23
item.description:
@Bacus23 wrote:

client.java:9801: illegal start of type
if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“x91”)) {
^
heres my code for pickup:
Code:

if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“x91”)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12));
if (/*newItemID <= 10000 && */newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10”);
}

heres the second error:
client.java:14115: (identifier) expected
public boolean inwildy = false;

heres my public boolean in wildy:
